There is in this country a great, unworked field. The colored race, numbering thousands upon thousands, appeals to the consideration and sympathy of every true, practical believer in Christ. These people do not live in a foreign country, and they do not bow down to idols of wood and stone. They live among us, and again and 
                                                                           510
again, through the testimonies of His Spirit, God has called our attention to them, telling us that here are human beings neglected.
